website_summaries.verdict: The Canon Pixma iP3500 inkjet printer is a great choice for home users who have basic print needs but still want good-looking prints.
pros: print speeds are on a par with the competition's

customer_reviews.title: SUPER Edible Image Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is used strictly as an edible image printer. Perfect for decorating cakes, cookies, cupcakes, and other baked goods. For cakes, you can use the full-size edible icing sheets. The cupcake and cookie sheets have pre-cut circles so that you can just punch them out and apply to the cookies and cupcakes after printing. This printer, with the edible ink, makes excellent looking images. How is this for printing on paper? I don't know, and I don't intend to find out. I don't recommend switching inks between edible ones and the regular (non-edible) ones. You don't want to be eating ink residue that could be toxic.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Nam

customer_reviews.title: Canon Inkjet great printer for a short time
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked well for very light duty use over less than six months. Then it stopped working. If it had continued unbroken, we would have awarded 4-5 stars. Suddenly, for no discernable reason,[1] ink cartridges started emptying at alarming rates even when a specific color was definitely never used. [2] The ink cartridge position drive screeched for a moment for each print job. [3] After each print, the sysem flased error message and had to be shut down and re-started. Even generous time provided by Canon customer service never solved the problem. The error message said: "return for repairs" which of course would have cost more than the printer was worth.
customer_reviews.author: Silver

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer
customer_reviews.text: I should have returned to a Cannon years ago. I've gone through the expense of buying two other printers before returning to Cannon. The quality of the prints is great, especially on quality paper. One of my big problems with other printers was the cost of cartridges and how long they last. I use this printer primarily for printing invoices for our small business and church projects. It does a great job and I think the cartridges last a reasonable amount of time. I had a Cannon Bubblejet many years ago and those cartridges seemed to last FOREVER! Wish I still had that printer. However, this is a great printer. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pattye Heuer

customer_reviews.title: First class printer
customer_reviews.text: I do think, that I did more research when looking for a new printer than I had done in the past when pondering most other items to be used with my two pcs. This IP3600 was in my price range, and functioned perfectly right out of the box.It replaced a couple of printers that had been less than adequate due to their age. The color is excellent... the "refill" replacement cartridges are inexpensive and available through many suppliers. Using our two PCs, we use a push button selector that enables either pc to use the new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Mumser

customer_reviews.title: Fine for an older Mac (OSX 10.3.9 or older)
customer_reviews.text: My old Canon printer at work gave up and died. No one locally works on Mac compatible anything so repairing it wasn't an option. I bought this printer because it was next to impossible to find one for my older Mac. I especially couldn't buy a printer locally that was capatible. I called Canon and their tech support people suggested this one. However, being in a small town / semi rural area, it wasn't available any place locally (like so many things - but that's another story). Thank goodness for Amazon; they saved the day one more time. If you have an older Mac (OSX 10.3.9 or less), this printer works.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Wymore

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...reliable
customer_reviews.text: I had a Epson for many yrs. have only gone thru 2 in about 15 yrs. Still would believe in epson if they fixed the clogging heads problem. tried HP and they are crap. decided try to a Canon. After much research and reading reviews here, decided did not want to invest too much(just in case it sucked). I was pleasently surprised. Prints well , nice colors. I do use it to print my photographs. Like most reviewers agree can be a bit noisey, especially at start up.I leave mine always on, also out of fear the ink heads may clog. Not taking any chances. Worth the money, a quality printer so far. Have had for about 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: slow as molasses
customer_reviews.text: This printer replaced an older Canon printer that became obsolete due to unavailability of replacement print heads. Problem with this printer, although the photos come out excellent, is that it takes forever to bring on line. Be prepared for a lot of down time as the printer goes through some unexpected preparations while you are waiting to print one page of type. The quality is good but printer is at times slow as molasses. Since I've got plenty of patience I recommend this printer. I went through six print heads with the older Canon printer so stocked up with an extra print head for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lucania

customer_reviews.title: Canon printers--never disappoint
customer_reviews.text: This printer replaces an earlier Canon printer I had. Print quality is excellent and overall, it's easy to use. Only this one isn't as convenient to change paper for printing, its only drawback. Instead of having the paper out in the open at the back of the printer. This one has the paper in a drawer that you pull out from the front. I do mostly regular printing, not photo priting, so can't evaluate the latter. But all of the pictures have been clearer and sharper than my previous printer. Amazon shipped quickly. I r4eceived it 2 days after placing the order!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I have read numerous reviews on different photo printers. I have bought a brother all in 1 printer few months ago & decided i wanted a printer just for straight photo printing. The quality on my 1st printer isn't too bad at all, but i wanted something nicer. I read a lot of good reviews on this model so I decided to order it & give this a try. I was amazed on how well the photo quality turned out. Its smooth, fast drying, & clean looking just like how photos look wen u took it somewhere to develop them. I don't have to rely on doing that no more.
customer_reviews.author: Alena

customer_reviews.title: Edible icing printing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to print on edible icing images for cake decorating using edible food safe ink cartridges. I get the sheets and "ink" from Photo Images. The first print, a picture of a guy wakeboarding, was so perfect I almost cried. I had been using another printer and had always wasted so many icing sheets, trying to get the color adjusted that having the first sheet come out perfectly was amazing. I don't know how this works for normal printing, but for my application it is a great printer, I am really happy with how it is working so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Canon IP 3600
customer_reviews.text: I found it frustrating following the directions of putting the ink cartridges in and I know the instructions were inaccurate in one of the steps of assembling the printer. The directions could definitely be more customer friendly for a novice. The software was easy to install,and the pictures' clarity is terrific and it's fast. I also like the fact that you can have photo paper loaded, as well as regular copy paper and the printer knows which to use. So far, I am very pleased with this model and I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Country Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, no longer made.
customer_reviews.text: I paid four times as much as I paid for my original iP3600 a few years ago -- but I love the printer so I bought this one to keep until the first one eventually dies. Love these Canon ink cartridges and all other Canon printers that use the same cartridge are not what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Cone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer and have had it a long time. It still kicks butt and makes photos look outstanding. The photos look like they are from a pro shop. I swear. I also use it in b&w mode to print scripts at low quality. It does great. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Davis

customer_reviews.title: 2 Computers Would Not Detect Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have two computers - both running Windows 7, and neither would detect the printer. I uninstalled the printer software twice, but no dice. Also, the printer does not come with a printer cable. (But I happened to have one from my last photo printer that I couldn't use anymore when I bought a laptop with Windows 7.) I will be returning the printer for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: H. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: After owning it for a couple of years I just put it to the test, with multiple printings of downloaded PDF files from the NY Times archives that was scanned and printed for OCR reproductions. All in all after printing off 144 pages for three copies, one of which was two sided, the iP3600 deserves a name all its own. How about...'The Printer king"?
customer_reviews.author: Warren Miller

customer_reviews.title: Color reproduction, excellent !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a Kodak 6.1 Hero, Very disapointing with color reproduction on card stock. Tried the canon ip3600 based on reviews. It is every bit the exceptional printer that the reviews state plus excellent tech support and as usual Amazon was there with unparalleled service.
customer_reviews.author: Norman E.

customer_reviews.title: iP3600 Failure
customer_reviews.text: The iP3600 installation and setup went smoothly on my Mac mini (OS X) but there was a "small" glitch: no ink would render to the paper. On the plus side, I was able to quickly get through to Canon customer support. However, that brief positive feeling of technical salvation soon turned to despair. After an hour of mind-numbing and redundant test procedures from a support guy a with a condescending attitude, he reluctantly acknowledged what was known 45 minutes earlier: there was a inherent malfunction. I returned it to Amazon (kudos to Amazon for paying the return postage because it was defective).
customer_reviews.author: sonomaboy

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3600 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Love that Canon makes a printer with four separate colors plus two black cartridges. If one color is empty, you only replace one and not an entire set. Print results are fantastic, especially set at higher preference. Price is good, too.
customer_reviews.author: S. lindy

customer_reviews.title: Duplex Printing Lacking
customer_reviews.text: The Pixma IP 3600 is a good printer - it replaced my Pixma IP4700. I like the feature of five ink tanks - just replace or refill the one that is empty. The duplex printing - two sided - is a joke. The operator must turn the sheet or sheets over and reinsert them in the rear paper tray to get the printing on side 2. The IP4700 did it all and that is what I was expecting when the description said duplex printing. There should have been more detail for those who want or need an easy two sided printer.
customer_reviews.author: Engrbyron

customer_reviews.title: Snatch & Grab Paper Jams and vibrates like a mini Earthquake
customer_reviews.text: Easily one of the WORST printers I have ever owned. It snatches paper from the bottom tray, which results in torn, wrinkled paper and constant paper jams. It also displays error messages on the computer telling me I have no paper left when there are at least 20 sheets in the tray. When it does work, it vibrates so much that my desk shakes like I'm in a California earthquake and pens, pencils, staplers and anything else falls off the desk. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Westchester County Today

customer_reviews.title: Great and simple.
customer_reviews.text: This Canon printer is the one recommended for edible printing photos to put on cupcakes and cakes. We have already started using it and it has worked really well. It is very easy to use and it has great quality. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable photo printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace a HPO 1200 all in one that died on me a couple months ago. I hooked the Canon up to Macbook Pro through my Airport Express. The setup was easy and I am very happy with the photo quality. Print speed isn't that great but I do not do too much printing for it to really matter. It is quieter than my old HP. I like the individual ink cartridges and dual paper trays... one for printer paper the other for photo paper.
customer_reviews.author: UXGuy

customer_reviews.title: So far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Receive my printer ans was excited about using it....This printer was bought for the purpose of printing edible pictures was happy with it's performance thus far would update status if quality and performance changes.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Bakes

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It has worked great as soon as it was plugged in. I like the dual paper capabilities. I can keep the cassette loaded with my everyday paper and when needed feed special paper or envelopes from the rear. Change over is done in software so there are no levers etc to fool with.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stoney

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP-3600
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer on the recommendation of a friend, who owns two for his home business. He has to print dozens of CD & DVD inserts at a time, which include photos & text. I've seen the result of his print jobs and they are excellent. I recieved delivery of mine sooner than expected. Setup was very easy and print results are very good. I've owned other brands but what I like most about the canon is the replacable print head, which means you don't have to bring it to a repair shop or toss it out if it becomes clogged.
customer_reviews.author: MikeSR

customer_reviews.title: Edible Printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer to use as a printer to print edible images for my cake decorating. I also purchased the edible inks but it did not come with the photo black. Does anyone know if you can use the ordinary photo black with the rest of the edible ink? Does not make sense. Can't seem to find edible photo black ink.
customer_reviews.author: Candee Leon

customer_reviews.title: Canon ip3600 Inkjet Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: Per good ratings on Amazon I bought the Canon ip3600. Turns out that it would not feed the paper from the bottom feeder. The paper more often than not would jam. The few pages that did print produced clean quality, easy to read images. Fortunately I was able to return the printer for a refund. I have yet to assess the high cost of ink. Fortunately I have no need for doing any volume of printing!!
customer_reviews.author: F. N. Luckow

customer_reviews.title: printer
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer,so much so that I purchased a second one for my son. I intend to use mine strictly for edible images for cakes, which I have used twice already. My son uses his for pictures, since he has finally gotten serious about his passion for photography.
customer_reviews.author: gerbear

customer_reviews.title: photo printer
customer_reviews.text: I took it out of the box, installed the software and drivers put in the edible in cartridges and printed away cake came out looking great
customer_reviews.author: eluv

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic printer
customer_reviews.text: A good, basic printer. I have a scanner for copying, scanning, etc. so I bought this because it is only a printer. (That's getting to be hard to find now days.) It does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: These pretzels are making me thirsty

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3600 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Easy to set up. Just wish I could use the extra inkjet tanks from previous Canon iP6000 printer
customer_reviews.author: Sue Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I received the printer and all is good. The software installed quickly and easily. The print quality (both text and pictures) is STUPENDOUS!
customer_reviews.author: Homer Zzyzzx

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer - scanner
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an older Canon printer which we had for many years and it is definitely worth the upgrade. Works flawlessly and the copy and print feature via wireless is extremely handy as there are no wires to connect to any computer, so the printer can be anywhere in the room. Only downside can think of is that the ink cartridges are a bit small and if you have a high print load you will find yourself replacing cartridges regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Spicy

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer Low Price Inks also
customer_reviews.text: Canon iP3600 does what I need in my home for personal occasional use. I probably print on-average 5-pages 50% coverage each week, so it doesn't get used much, but what it does produce is color accurate and sharp. I'm happy with it. (I bought this unit to replace my Canon iP3000). Inks available on Amazon.com at incredibly reasonable prices (with chip).
customer_reviews.author: John Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: A great selection
customer_reviews.text: It took only several days for me to receive this printer. I replaced my Lexmark Z55 with this printer. The printer is super fast. The finished product looks as though I used a laser printer. The printer also came with a 1 year warranty. Everything that I order from Amazon so far receives 5 stars. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3600 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer arrived very fast. Would not print after all options failed. Called Canon customer service and after about 10 minutes of failed tries they sent a replacement printer of a different model (iP4920). It worded fine. Customer serive said it was a hardwire failure?
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3600 Inkjet Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my business. I use it to print edible images. It prints beautiful edible image pages, clear and precise. The printer head can be easily removed and cleaned. The printer is the best investment that I could have made for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Late on this review, but it's good because I got to see that the product still works great, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Melody Rae

customer_reviews.title: super printer and a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second IP3600 that I have purchased. They provide very good images and use very little ink as compared to HP, for example, Very reliable. I will continue to purchase Canon products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Z

customer_reviews.title: Good printer!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Canon printers in the past and always been very satisfied. They do last and are a great value. This one is the best we've owned and nice quality. I do like the idea of the separate cartridges! I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Gail4403

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP 3600 Inkjet photo printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to use for text only and it prints out beautifully.I may use for photos at some point and time but the price point on this is excellent for whatever your needs.I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CK Mills

customer_reviews.title: Canon Printer IP3600 review
customer_reviews.text: This printer was easy to set up and easy to use. I had to send the first one back because it wouldn't recognize the printer cartridges. Amazon quickly sent me another one and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: BCDGIFTS

customer_reviews.title: Paper jammer
customer_reviews.text: Paper will jam often from front loaded cartridge. I have to use the rear paper loading option. I bought so I can refill ink. Will see how that works when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: thenewmexican

customer_reviews.title: worked
customer_reviews.text: Great printer till you try to use it on Win10
customer_reviews.author: Ajmes A.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice printer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. It has a install routine that asks for some input from printed items, to set it up that were simple enough, that I never had to do before with a printer. So far everything works great and the print was also great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Race

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a very economical printer. It prints awesome pictures and is also great for everyday use. It's nice that there are five individual ink cartridges so that you only have to replace the color that runs out. I love this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Alissa P.

customer_reviews.title: Lowest price ink cartridges
customer_reviews.text: PC World said the Pixma ip4700 had the lowest ink cost of any printer currently on the market. This printer, ip3600 uses the same cartridges. You would have to spend a lot more $ to beat the photo quality. Far superior to my HP Office Jet.
customer_reviews.author: justed

customer_reviews.title: iPF3600 far exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have the 17" Canon iPF printer and when my Epson, I will never own one again, photo printer died I had to find a replacement.. This small printer far far far exceeded my expectations. The price was right and I have recommended this to all of my students.
customer_reviews.author: Glen I. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: This printer is good. A little noisy though and takes a while to get ready to print. You have to reload the printer before it is completely out of paper and someitmes the sensor thinks there is none there when there really is.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beaudoin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good Printer
customer_reviews.text: Prints nicely and is fast. Only problem is that paper jamming from the front (lower) tray is a regular problem. If you use the back (upper) tray there is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Canon ip3600 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great Printer. Use mostly for Photos. I use off market inks and they work well and save me a load of money. I like the multi ink supply and only have to replace the color that is expended rather than a multi color cartridge (wasteful). I had the ip 4600 prior to this one and don't notice a difference. Price on Amazon was Excellent. Delivery and packing was fast and of good quality. I like to shop on Amazon for most of my needs . Prices are very competitive.
customer_reviews.author: shalimar

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3600 MET ALL MY EXPECTATIONS
customer_reviews.text: Met all my expectations. I will probaly buy more Canon printers or scanners in the future. The software was capatible with my IMAC computer.
customer_reviews.author: TIMOTHY F. MISKELL

customer_reviews.title: wifi sucks and it needs a cord
customer_reviews.text: doesn't come with a cord to connect directly to a computer. if the wifi part of it worked properly i wouldn't mind that it didn't come with a cord but every time i turn it on it's a battle to get it to pick up the wifi and even when it does pick up wifi i get a connection error from my computer when i try to print.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Gave 3 stars as some assembly is required and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave 3 stars as some assembly is required and I am not able to put mine together because I am worried about breaking it. I read and fully understand the directions but can not seem to get one of the pieces inserted. This thing is still sitting in my spare room in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: A very nice printer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. The print quality and colors look good. The only problem I had was how to load the bottom tray, so I switched it to top load only.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Labadie Jr.

customer_reviews.title: printer
customer_reviews.text: getting paper to feed from bottom tray was difficult to get just right at first but am satisfied with the printer now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Petty

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Economical
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my home office. I don't do much printing, but the output is high quality. It's easy to set up and use, but you have to buy a USB cord separately, which is why I didn't give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: K.D. Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Print Quality
customer_reviews.text: The mechanical features are better than the i960 it replaced, but the print quality is not as good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am very glad I purchased this printer. It was affordable and I like how I was not forced to buy a scanner with it.
customer_reviews.author: Illusions & Preaching

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great printer that prints excellent photos. I cannot think of a single negative when it comes to this printer. It was well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JIsaacs8

customer_reviews.title: photo printer
customer_reviews.text: It is a good photo printer. I do recomend getting the extra cable thou I had to go out and get one the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Linda lou

customer_reviews.title: Missing a part
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the printer is missing a part that goes where the ink is inserted. I called Canon, and they told me that this printer was purchased from Canon in 2008. I've only had it for a couple of months, haven't been able to use it, and can't find the receipt. What now?.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: We've had the printer a few days now, this is very much like our canon3000 and wroks very much the same. The cost of ink is good. this one is a little faster and less noisty. Not happy with shipping speed. When you Choose free shipping. Order was placed on Monday morning Not shipped until Thurs. and a FULL 9 DAYS until we recieved it. This is the slowest s/h I've every had with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon-1

customer_reviews.title: Use of ink
customer_reviews.text: It is a good printer, except it prints slow. I The ink capacity is about 1/3 the capicity in the Canon S900.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Antrobus

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: We were disappointed that the printer wouldn't paper feed. (This happened on a newer version Canon I had.) I bought this for my 91 year old computer savy mother. Big disappointment! I paid someone to install it for her, but the printer didn't work. Buying this as a gift makes returns a nightmare. We're wondering how we get the return label printed out and the box back to Amazon. I like Canon's so I'm ordering another one to replace this one. BUT, if this was turns out bogus that's it for me with Canons.
customer_reviews.author: Pat McG

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3600 photo printer
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but a bit slow though speed, or lack thereof, is probably related to it's photo capabilities. Quality of print good. Overall, I'm pretty much satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hosford

customer_reviews.title: Bargain price for printer but they swindle you with the ink
customer_reviews.text: After a few months I stopped using the printer as the ink cartridges sold by Canon barely printed anything. Printing with this printer got ridiculously expensive. I go to my local photocopy place now and this printer sits here gathering dust.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Name

customer_reviews.title: Arrived and didn't work
customer_reviews.text: My new printer arrived and did not print correctly. We contacted Canon and they sent directions on how to test the printer. We followed the directions and the printer still did not work. Canon sent us new ink cartirages, then a new print head and none of the items corrected the problem. Finally they sent us a reconditioned printer which works fine but I purchased a new printer not a refirbished one and it arrived with just a 30 day warrantee rather than a one year warrantee as my printer I purchased was to have. I suppose my reconditioned printer should work for a long time but it was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3600 Inkjet Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought two identical printers, one great, one not so good.Mine of course being the woman, got the sick one. all printing is crooked, tried moving the paper, no luck. Top printer does great pictures. Bottom says no paper when its full or otherwise. Husband's work's great of course, no one wants to complain with a man.Tried to get my husband to trade with me, since he doesn't print from computer much, just lot's of pictures which on both are good. Darn, no luck, he wants his.Don't know what I'm going to do yet.
customer_reviews.author: Susie S.

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP3600
customer_reviews.text: Love the separate ink tanks which allow for re-filling & only of the color(s) needed @ the time.Saves lotsa $! SOftware speed slow from computer to printer as compared to other less-expensive brand. Prefer paper loading format that is easier to immediately access, as for 2-sided printing.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Mullenioux

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It's good product. i'm very hapy because the printer prints with good quality and very sharp pictures. I'm recomend with the eye close.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: An important tool to have
customer_reviews.text: This printer is not only affordable but edable ink compadable. As a novice baker this printer has allowed me to deliver profesional cakes with little effort Highly recommend this printer'
customer_reviews.author: Olga Robles

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Delivery
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered in a box with no product packaging, no styrofoam pacing and all the components loose. There was another delivery label under the one with my address and it was obvious that it had been sold to another customer first who had unpacked it and decided to return it and it was then just sent off to me without Amazon even checking the contents. I will never buy anything from Amazon again. It's a miracle that the printer works at all.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this printer to a single person. The only good thing about it is that you can buy 3rd party ink pretty readily. Printing anything takes about 5 minutes of noises and a blinking light. After about every 5th page the printer thinks that its out of paper, and I must fiddle with the tray and paper button for 30 seconds. Half of the documents that I send the printer are never actually printed. Overall the printer is just a piece of junk. I love Canon cameras, but I will never buy another printer from them again. The printer feels like cheap plastic and acts like it too.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: printer did not work, I would like my money back!
customer_reviews.text: The printer did not work, flashing off line and would not be remedied. Also did not come with a manuel.
customer_reviews.author: timberlake1

product_meta.title: Canon iP3600 Inkjet Photo Printer (2868B002)
product_meta.description:
Canon iP3600 inkjet photo printer is remarkable photo printer with individual ink tanks and PictBridge.

AMAZON.COM
Manufacturer Product Description You’re going to love the results from this compact photo printer. Its new 5-color ink system –four dye-based inks and a pigment-based black ink – produces vivid colors and bold, black text. Patented print head technology lets you create long-lasting photos with resolution up to an amazing 9600 x 2400 color dpi. How fast? A photo lab-quality 4 x 6 inch borderless print takes only about 41 seconds. 

 

PIXMA iP3600 Photo Printer:

 * 9600 x 2400 color dpi resolution. 
 * Two-Way paper feeding for convenient plain and photo paper handling 
 * Auto Photo Fix - optimizes your images for such factors as skin tone, white balance and brightness, and makes red-eye corrections. 







Just capture an image with a PictBridge ready digital camera/DV camcorder, then connect and print! View larger You can also print photos directly from a compatible digital camera or camera phone – no computer required! The two paper trays let you store both plain and photo paper, so you’re always print-ready. And the included software features Auto Photo Fix, which corrects redeye and enhances your images. Long-Lasting Beautiful Photos
ChromaLife100+ system delivers vibrant photos that last up to 300 years. 

Spectacular Resolution
Maximum 9600 x 2400 dpi with microscopic droplets as small as 1 picoliter using FINE Technology. 



High Performance Ink Cartridges
The two genuine Canon ink cartridges contain specially formulated inks for the highest possible quality. They’re easy to use and to replace as needed. 

Advanced Z-lid
The unique Z-lid expansion top enables you to scan or copy bulky or thick items. It lifts approximately 3/4-inch vertically then lays down flat on the page for clear, complete copies or scans from edge to edge. 

 

FINE Technology
Canon Full-photolitho-graphy Inkjet Nozzle Engineering (FINE) uses a patented print head with 2,368 precision nozzles, injecting ink droplets as small as 1 picoliters. More nozzles = amazing images.

Dual Paper Trays 
Two-Way paper feeding for convenient plain and photo paper handling

Quick Start
Powering up your printer is now faster than ever. After pressing the power button, you can begin inputting commands in approximately 2 seconds. Full operation is



 even enabled in a shorter time now too.

Automatic Image Optimization
Just one of the features on the included Easy-PhotoPrint EX software – Auto Photo Fix - optimizes your images for such factors as skin tone, white balance and brightness, and makes red-eye corrections.

Click-Connect-Print
Just capture an image with a PictBridge ready digital camera/DV camcorder, then connect and print!

Maximum 9600 x 2400 dpi with microscopic droplets as small as 1 picoliter using FINE technology
"Easy-PhotoPrint EX" software with enhanced "auto photo fix" easily removes red eye
2-Way paper feeding for convenient plain and photo paper handling
Has a Spectacular Resolution with Maximum 9600 x 2400 dpi with microscopic droplets as small as 1 picoliter using FINE Technology
